Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Bowl
Description: Hemispherical bowl with an extremely flared and rounded lip. The clay is fine, compact, highly micaceous and buff-coloured. The surface has been polished. The vase was placed in a hearth and this resulted in the blackening of a large portion of the body of the vessel.
